Job Description: About UOBUnited Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.About the DepartmentThe Data Management Office and Big Data Analytics function answers the demand for quality and credible data across the Group.Data Management OfficeWe govern the use of data across the Group and provide guidance for data management and usage. This optimises the value of data to enable smarter, faster and more accurate decision-making as well as improve operational efficiency. Above all, we ensure adherence to all data governance standards as determined by regulators.Big Data AnalyticsWe are a centralised analytics function that supports Group-wide business units and their analytical needs. We aim to establish ourselves as an analytics centre of excellence and drive analytics adoption and the utilisation of new big data technology across the Group. Our key areas of service range from business intelligence, strategic analytics to data science.Job ResponsibilitiesThe role is a key member of the Enterprise Data Governance Team which supports the Head of Enterprise Data Governance and Quality in defining and operationalising the long-term vision, strategy and objectives for data governance across the Group that are in line with the Bank`s business strategy and objectives. Your main responsibilities are to:Actively support the UOB Group-wide Data Governance strategy and the adoption of the data governance framework and policy, incorporating best practices and industry standards across different jurisdictions where the Bank operates.Actively contribute to the development and continuous evolution of the data governance processes and best practices in line with the Bank's strategies and objectives, along with evolving industry practicesSupport the development, maintenance and improvement of data governance processes and controls across the end to end data lifecycle by incorporating industry best practices on data governance, data quality and data protectionParticipate in Bank-wide initiatives to promote responsible sharing of data across business functions, between subsidiaries and entities as well as with external parties.Participate in Bank-wide initiatives to embed data governance and data protection practices into existing enterprise-wide policies and processes.Participate in the development of data standards incorporating industry best practices across Reference data, Master data and Metadata.Promote education and develop training, awareness and adoption program of Data Governance disciplines and objectives across the Group.Serve as a liaison between business units and technology to ensure data governance requirements are well understood and considered as part of operational prioritization and planningBe an agent of change and inculcate data governance culture and discipline across the Bank's business and technical processesJob RequirementsDegree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Computing or related disciplines with at least 5 years of working experience in the banking industry, or consulting industry with strong exposure to Financial ServicesExtensive knowledge and understanding of Data Governance discipline, especially on financial industry best practices and across the regulatory landscapeGood understanding of data protection, data privacy and related disciplines, such as knowledge of personal data related regulations and lawsGood understanding of data management and related disciplines, such as data architecture, data quality and metadataExperience of working with Big Data platforms and ETL tools is an advantageGood project management and facilitation skills, with the ability to manage different stakeholders across the Bank and to navigate through conflicts with easeDemonstrated ability as team player and running initiatives independentlyGood written / oral communication skills with strong interpersonal skillsBe a part of UOB FamilyUOB is an equal opportunity employer. Job Description: The Asian School of the Environment (ASE) invites applications for the position of Research Fellow (RF) with Asst. Prof. Eleanor Slade's research group.This position is supported by a project recently funded by the Singapore National Research Foundation on the ecology and restoration of tropical peat forests with a particular focus on the pristine and degraded peat forests of Brunei. The project is managed jointly by the ASE and the Singapore-MIT Alliance of Research and Technology (SMART) and will be overseen in collaboration with colleagues from the ASE and SMART. There will also be assistance from a research technician and from field staff based in Brunei.Job ResponsibilitiesDesign and implement fieldwork and laboratory analysis on invertebrate ecologyData management and statistical analysesWork effectively with project PIs and local collaboratorsMentor junior colleagues, as neededWrite and publication of results in peer-reviewed journalsOrganize and conduct field work in intact and degraded peat forests in BruneiSetting up experiments and measurements aimed at understanding invertebrate biodiversity and related ecosystem functions in intact and degraded peat forest ecosystemsSeeing this work through to publication in major research journalsJob RequirementsPhD degree in ecology or closely related field, preferably with a focus on invertebrate and ecosystem ecologyExperience working with invertebratesKnowledge and preferably experience of molecular and/or stable isotope techniquesFieldwork experience in forested ecosystems, and in sometimes challenging field conditionsExperience with statistical analysis with RPrior experience in publishing in peer-reviewed scientific journalsKey Competency RequirementsAbility to work independently to develop research and execute fieldwork in tropical rainforests, in conditions that are sometimes challengingCollaborative, with interest to work with other researchers and scientists (this is a large team project) to produce high-quality and impactful researchInterest in invertebrates, ecosystem functioning, restoration, and tropical forestsExcellent oral and written communication skills in EnglishWillingness to learn Malay would also be advantageous as RF will spend substantial amounts of time in the field in Brunei working with local field assistants and studentsInterested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and full CV in one document.Enquiries about this position can be made to Asst. Prof. Eleanor Slade ([emailprotected]).We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

must be equally comfortable discussing the enterprise information management (EIM) strategic perspective with executives and implementation details with operational staff and IT.Organizational/political agility with the ability to drive large, cross-functional data management programs involving coordination with multiple stakeholders.Ability to help define and articulate the enterprise data management strategic vision and translate it into tactical implementable steps to C level.Solid knowledge of the organization's industry and its challenges in the use of data and information.Certification in data management and understanding of the various technologies of data management within an organization.Strategic decision-making skills with a high degree of latitude.Financial services domain knowledge, including expertise at the intersection of risk, finance and customer domains.Expertise in business and IT architecture, including familiarity with leading architectural standards such as TOGAF, FEA and/or Zachman.Familiarity with Enterprise Metadata Management (business and IT) and OMG standards.Information management program life cycle experience.Experience in operationalizing Data Governance, Data Stewardship and Data Quality.Familiarity with industry data models such as IBM BDW and IIW, Teradata FSLDM, and SAS IIA.End-to-end data warehousing program execution knowledge and leadership.Familiarity with software development lifecycles.Experience in defining business requirements for information management projects.Familiarity with process modeling, semantic modeling and data modelling.High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork.Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes.About Great EasternEstablished in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner.We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us.We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions.Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people's lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management.To all recruitment agencies:Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Job Description: The Traffic Development & Economics team sits within Changi Airport Consultants, supporting transactions, asset management and third-party consulting with data science, economic modelling and analysis. The team tackles a range of aviation-centred economics questions, ranging from passenger forecasts for CAI assets to optimal commercial rent pricing for external clients.Economists have the opportunity to engage cross-functionally with Traffic Development, Operations, Commercial and Asset Management colleagues in delivery of their work. Alongside strong quantitative and programming skills, Economists also excel in written and verbal communication, allowing them to explain complex concepts clearly and accessibly.Responsibilities:·Conduct macroeconomic research and analysis to support risk-profiling and financial assessment of potential or current airport investments.·Develop econometric forecasts of traffic and other relevant aviation metrics for investments or third-party clients.·Partner with adjacent verticals and draw on other CAI assets to gather relevant datasets for tactical data mining.·Build data products, frameworks and pipelines which modularise analysis for speed and replicability.Requirements:·Bachelors or Masters Degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or other quantitative subjects. A minor in Economics with undergraduate economic theory and econometrics is the minimum requirement.·At least 2 years hands-on experience using R, Python or other open-source statistical programming languages with various datasets, alongside core statistical and machine learning packages.·Familiarity with tools across the data value chain from SQL to Jupyter and Power BI/Tableau.·Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite and adjacent plugins, specifically advanced Excel, PowerPoint and think-cell.·Excellent written and verbal communication and ability to explain economic concepts and statistical results clearly, as evidenced from past work or research.·Possessing one or more of the following skills/experiences will be advantageous:ØFamiliarity with analytical techniques like IO or DSGE modelling.ØExperience developing or contributing to financial models for project/infrastructure finance.ØPrevious work with machine learning packages beyond the core e.g. Tensorflow/Keras and mxnet.ØKnowledge of, and experience with, a cloud toolstack (e.g. AWS or Azure) or open-source deployment stack.We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Job Description: Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine invites applications for:Research Fellow in the Laboratory of Assistant Professor XIA YunLee Kong Chian School of Medicine (LKCMedicine) established in September 2010 is a partnership between Imperial College London and Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. The School operates from two campuses – Yunnan Campus at Nanyang Technological University and a new campus to be built at Novena. Our primary healthcare partner is the National Healthcare Group (NHG) which comprises an integrated network of primary healthcare polyclinics, acute care hospitals such as Tan Tock Seng Hospital, and national specialist centres. LKCMedicine delivers a new five-year undergraduate medical programme leading to a joint MBBS degree awarded by Imperial College London and Nanyang Technological University.We are currently recruiting a self-motivated research fellow to work in the area of stem cell in vitro lineage specification and organogenesis. The appointee will be working on using organoid models to understand human development and diseases.One of the main research goals of our lab is to develop novel bioengineering approaches to derive functional kidney-like tissues that could be used for both disease modelling and replacement therapy. Our lab is also interested in emulating early embryogenesis and organ formation processes using human stem cell-based embryoids. The appointee is encouraged to participate in multiple projects running parallel in the lab.Responsibilities:Research workTake the lead of running the posted project, produce data for paper publication, grant application, and technology disclosure.Establish CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing/screening system in human pluripotent stem cells.Processing of data and analysis of results from RNA sequencing and single cell RNA sequencing experiments.Manuscript writing, plot graphs, and data presentation.Participate in lab managing and project supervision.Participate in training junior lab members including PhD students, undergraduate interns, and research assistants.Laboratory managementParticipate, responsibly, in general lab management and maintenance, as well as data storage and management.Basic requirements:Candidates must have a PhD degree in cell biology and biochemistry/molecular biology/ stem cell biology.At least one first author publication in peer reviewed journals (preferably IF > 10).Excellent organizational and communication skills, fluent in spoken and written English.Skills and qualifications:Experience with cell and molecular biology, biochemistry techniques. Experience with human embryonic stem cell/induced pluripotent stem cell culture and 3D organoid culture is an advantage.Experience with CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing tools.Have strong background in microscopic work. Experience with pathology and histology is an advantage.Ability to handle and work with transgenic mice, and perform histology analyses. Experience with animal surgery and mouse embryonic dissection is an advantage.Prior experience in handling large next-generation sequencing datasets is an advantage.Quick learner with excellent organization and communication skills.Ability to work well independently and also effectively as part of a team.Highly motivated, independent, responsible, and willingness to share knowledge. An outgoing personality is much appreciated.Hiring Institution: LKC

Job Description: Functional Proteomics Laboratory at IMCB is a high profile group with unique portfolio. It gathers broad expertise from diverse fields including biochemistry, immunology, cell biology and mass spectrometry. The laboratory’s long-term research interest is focused on the integration of the cell biology and immunology with quantitative mass spectrometry-based proteomics. Candidate will be responsible for data presentation and reporting results to lab members and collaborators.Job RequirementsMaster’s or PhD in computational science, biostatistics or related fieldWilling to learn/acquire new knowledgeCapabilities to write scripts or programs to solve computational problemsStrong interest in computational science and its application in biomedical sciencesKnowledge of mass spectrometry is not a prerequisite but will be advantageousAbility to multitask, work independently, and also as part of a teamExcellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skillsGood publication recordSalary will be commensurate with qualifications and experienceThe above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. Job Description:
A bioinformatician position (PhD) is available at the A*STAR IMCB ???Laboratory of Chromatin Dynamics & Disease Epigenetics.
Our laboratory is interested to study chromatin dynamics in development and disease, with a particular focus on cancer (Hu et al., Nature Cell Biology 2020). To this end, we leverage next-generation sequencing technologies to investigate how transcriptional and epigenetic dysregulations lead to carcinogenesis. Through integrative analyses of cancer epigenomic, genomic and transcriptomic data, we aim to obtain a comprehensive understanding of the complex architecture of cancer genomes, and to identify potential cancer vulnerabilities for therapeutic intervention. For more information about the lab, please see: https://wwteelab.com
Job Requirements
We are looking for a candidate with some experience working with next generation sequencing datasets such as RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq, Methyl-Seq as well as Hi-C/Hi-ChIP.
?? Bachelor???s/Master???s/PhD degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, or a related field. 
?? Proficiency in R and/or Python scripting language. 
?? Prior experience with next-generation-sequencing data analysis such as those listed above, and able to perform multi-modal integration of the different -omics datasets. 
?? Track record of peer-reviewed publications in relevant disciplines will be advantageous. 
?? Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
?? Able to undertake independent research and be an effective team player. 
An attractive remuneration package that is commensurate with the qualifications, track record and working experience of the successful candidate will be provided. The successful candidate will also have the opportunity to lead projects and work collaboratively with others in conceptualizing and conducting research projects.
Interested applicants should email his/her curriculum vitae, a cover letter addressing research interest, experience and skills, and contact information of three referees toDr. Wee-Wei Tee([emailprotected]).

Job Description: Job DescriptionThe Rackham Lab within the Centre for Computational Biology in Duke-NUS, uses data-driven tools to find the key regulators of cell fate in order to develop novel cell therapies and disease interventions. This research project combines CRISPR tools with network biology to find novel regulators of cardiovascular disease. The project will combine both wet and dry scientists and require the development of new computational/statistical tools, with this post focused on the experimental tools and cell culture.We are looking for a dynamic Senior Research Fellow with knowledge and research skills in cell reprogramming, next-generation sequencing and CRISPR-activation to work on addressing clinically relevant problems in cardiovascular disease. The candidate will join the laboratory of Assistant Professor Owen Rackham whose team combine computational and experimental tools to study disease in a data-driven way. The post will be a short contract of ~1 year.The selected candidate will perform a variety of research activities, including but not limited to the following:Perform independent research projects and develop connections with local and international researchers for collaboration work.Write and review research papers, present research outcomes, conceptualise new ideas and develop plans for independent research which could have a considerable influence and impact on the relevant field attracting research funding.Apply qualitative and quantitative research techniques which include accurate in-depth assessment, interpretation and evaluation of research outcomes.Maintain optimal experiment progress in the laboratory or in the research work undertaken.Contribute to project management, provision of guidance to more junior researchers as well as undergraduate and graduate students, occasional educational/instructional activities.Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.Job RequirementsPhD in a related scientific area (Science/Life Sciences) with at least 5 years of postdoctoral experience.Experienced in performing RNAseq, ATACseq, scRNAseq and/or RiboSeq.Experience with viral transfection for overexpression, knockdown or CRISPRa/CRISPRi.Proven track record in the form of high impact publications.Demonstrated capability of research independence.Proven ability to work harmoniously in a team and to establish and maintain effective professional peer working relationships.We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.More InformationLocation: Duke-NUS Medical SchoolOrganization: Duke-NUS Medical SchoolDepartment : Duke-NUS Medical SchoolEmployee Referral Eligible: N.A.Job requisition ID : 7690

Job Description: Position Summary:As a Senior Scientist within Illumina’s Consumables Manufacturing Science team, you will work as part of a multi-disciplinary team to develop methods for the production and testing of new process formulas, technologies and products for Array and Sequencing products. You will involve in new product scale-up, process optimization, technology transfer and/or process validation activities. This integral role includes developing production procedures, product specifications, use professional concepts, deep science knowledge and procedures to resolve a wide range of difficult technical problems to establish processes and products with the world-class performance, stability and robustness characteristics that meet quality and our customer requirements. You will be responsible too in developing assays by designing and executing experiments, collecting data, performing analysis, drawing conclusions and presenting to key stakeholders.Position Responsibilities:Constructs and executes experiments, communicate results and conclusions to aid decision-making in definition and improvement, design, development and quality test activities for Array and Sequencing products and processes.Expand and establish novel methods, assays and tools to enable mechanistically characterization and study on materials and products.Defines technical requirements and procedures for scaling up and optimizing new products to production.Contribute to ongoing manufacturing science projects in a fast-paced environment.Lead or participate in complex technical issues to establish improvement solutions to correct or prevent recurrence of product and process failure.Work closely with other chemists, biochemists, integration scientists and engineers to develop assays, processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.Present results and data to collaborators, extended teams on a regular basis and senior management when needs.Leads or supports development of key strategic program, complete design and projects within schedule, budget and quality constraints.Keep detailed lab notebooks, prepare engineering study reports, updates, and summaries.Upkeep of lab equipment, laboratory supplies and good housekeeping.Provides guidance to junior scientists.Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Job Description: Position Summary:Illumina is the leading provider of sequencing instruments globally. Our users include leading research institutes, biotech, healthcare and agriculture companies, among others. The rapid drop in sequencing cost per Gb coupled with high accuracy, enabled by our constantly evolving instruments have made possible applications that were hitherto infeasible, such as non-invasive pre-natal testing (NIPT) as well as the exciting prospect of early stage cancer diagnosis using circulating cell-free DNA detection.As the cost of DNA sequencing has continued to drop, the bottleneck has moved from cost of sequencing to cost of sample preparation, particularly for samples that need high depth or additional processing.To address this situation, we’ve started a new effort to improve the sample prep workflow and are seeking a motivated and qualified Research Associate to join an existing team working to develop new enzymes and protocols for the same.The successful candidate will initiate, execute and analyze research applied to sequencing technology, collaboratively working with multidisciplinary teams.Position Responsibilities:Participate in multi-disciplinary protein engineering projects, contributing to the molecular biology/protein biochemistry aspects.Communicate ideas and data with engineers, chemists, and protein scientists, to deliver protein variants with desired properties.Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.Position Requirements:2 years of hands-on experience in molecular biology and protein expression and purification preferably in E.coli.Sound understanding of the latest tools and methodologies in protein expression, purification and characterization.Comfortable meeting deadlines in a fast-paced biotech environment.Good communication skills.All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.Preferred Experience/Education/Skills:B.Sc. or M.Sc. in biochemistry, protein engineering, molecular biology.Experience with NGS is desirable.Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Job Description: Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there's no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that's the kind of work we want to be part of.You will be joining the Purification Development team within Development Services in Lonza Singapore. The Development Services group are responsible for the development and characterization manufacturing processes used for the production of novel therapeutic recombinant proteins for Lonza's global client base. The purpose of this role is successfully deliver projects to meet the business goals with a team of junior scientists. This role is also expected to provide technical expertise for the downstream process development activities and to support troubleshooting activities at both laboratory and manufacturing scale.Based primarily in a new lab in Singapore Tuas, the Process Development team works closely with our Customers, and with different functions including MSAT, Manufacturing, Regulatory, Proposal/Program Management, Supply Chain and Quality Assurance.Key responsibilities:Plan and prepare for work stages to support the delivery of studies for multiple clinical phase (IND) and support late stage validation (BLA) projects.Contribute to process development activities by performing supporting laboratory scale studies which may employ DoE methodologies.Interpret analytical data provided by the analytical team to define subsequent steps.Reviewing/drafting protocols, reports, proposals, presentations and scientific data to maintain the highest level of quality standards within the departmentDeliver high quality communication to ensure an outstanding customer experience (written reports, telecons, face to face meetings).Working as part of a site and global project team, co-ordinate multiple projects and ensure timely delivery of project workstages.Purification activities include affinity and ion exchange chromatography using the AKTA system, ultrafiltration/diafiltration and viral reduction strategies.Key requirements:Degree/PhD in a relevant Science field or EquivalentMinimum 5 years work experience or PhD with 2 years postdoctoral experienceThe final role offered will be commensurate with the candidate's experience.Practical laboratory experience in protein purification is required.Understanding of theory and application of protein purificationUnderstanding of cGMP regulations will be advantageousGood problem solving and analytical skillsGood communication skills (verbal and written)Good team working skillsEvery day, Lonza's products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. Job Description: Hummingbird Bioscience builds revolutionary biotherapeutics through the application of proprietary biological insights and technologies. We are on a mission to unravel the complexities of human disease. Using systems biology, we find new and elusive drug targets and engineer breakthrough biotherapeutics to precisely intercept them, giving people hope for new treatments when all others have failed. This is a bold, new way of finding the right drugs for the right people.Hummingbird Bioscience has built a pipeline of promising drugs expected to enter clinical trials in 2020. With locations in Singapore, Houston, Texas and South San Francisco, California, Hummingbird is well funded by venture capital and has established strategic collaborations with Cancer Research UK and Amgen. To learn more about our science, pipeline assets, and team, please visit: www.hummingbirdbioscience.comJOB DESCRIPTIONHummingbird Bioscience is seeking for a Research Scientist, Antibody Research to join and contribute to a fast-paced team with antibodydiscoveryplatform and ample opportunity to grow with the company.This will be a permanent role for the right candidate.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESDesign, execute, and lead laboratory projects as part of our Antibody Discovery platform.Establish, develop, and validate new immunological assays/technologies or platform in the laboratory when required in order to characterize novel antibodies.Adapt new methods to existing procedures and modify current experiments through scientific knowledge and intuition.Maintain accurate, detailed, and up-to-date records of all laboratory work and experiments in electronic files.Draft, write and edit internal scientific reports and research records.Operate and troubleshoot complex equipment with minimal supervision.Work closely with supervisor and peers to meet project deadlines.Contribute to the overall safety and organization of the laboratory.Possess flexibility to adapt to sudden changes in direction according to project requirements.Demonstrate attendance and punctuality, consistency in carrying out instructions, accuracy & attention to detail, achieving expected results & continuous improvement.Maintain an integral role in the laboratory's meetings, presentations, and publications. Present information on research and laboratory work to others at laboratory meetings.Comfortable in a fast-paced high-pressure R&D setting.ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONSPhD in Immunology, Biochemistry or related field.Minimum 5 years of experience in Immunology research laboratory. Experience in a private company will be considered a plus.Strong experience required in antibody development (ELISA, Flow cytometry, B cell cloning, antibody engineering). Good knowledge of molecular biology technologies desired (PCR, cloning, sequencing management). Previous participation in the discovery and development of an antibody is highly desirable.Track record (patents and/or publications) in antibody discovery and development is highly desirable.Experience with mammalian cell culture and Yeast expression system is a plus.Fast learner. Ability to work independently.Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Ability to communicate results and thoughts concisely and clearly in a timely manner.Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.Disciplined, well-organized, and positive attitude.DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONSTo apply for the above role, please send a maximum 2-page resume in PDF format, detailing your education and relevant experience, and a cover letter with your motivations for applying for this position

Job Description: Research Associate (Computer Science/Engineering) #SGUnitedJobs #RIEProgramme SummaryThe new Work and Skills Immersion Programme (WSIP) offers fresh graduates and mid-career job seekers a variety of contract work-and-train opportunities, typically on a two-year basis, in key capability areas in the public sector. The positions offered by NTU under this programme aims to support the development of science and technology talents as they are key to the nation’s ability to meet future challenges and respond to shifts in the global economy.Successful applicants are employed full-time and receive structured and on-the-job training. By developing in-demand skills, they will be ready to pursue more job opportunities when the economy recovers after the Covid-19 crisis.About Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research InstituteNanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) and Alibaba Group officially launched the Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute (JRI) in February 2018. This is Alibaba’s first research institute on AI outside China.The joint research institute seeks to combine NTU’s human-centred AI technology which has been applied to areas such as health, ageing, homes and communities, with Alibaba’s leading technologies including Natural Language Processing (NLP), computer vision, machine learning and cloud computing to explore further technology breakthroughs and real-life AI solutions.Over the next five years, the JRI will push the frontiers of AI to change the current technology-centric philosophy of AI research into one which is human-centric. The goal is make AI to become more effective, accessible and inclusive so that it can address future societal needs in ageless aging, new lifestyles and human-centered mobility.These AI and cloud technologies will be developed and tested on the NTU Smart Campus to demonstrate the effectiveness of the solutions before taking them to the market in Singapore and rest of the world. The program dovetails with Singapore’s ambition to train AI and data-science talent to support the country’s “Smart Nation” vision and its transformation to “Industry 4.0”. The JRI are led by researchers from NTU-UBC Research Centre of Excellence in Active Living for the Elderly (LILY) and the School of Computer Science and Engineering.Job DescriptionsConducting research in the area of federated learning for the Internet of Things applications from security and efficiency aspectsWriting high-quality research papers targeting prestigious conferences and journals in the relevant fieldsCoordinating research projects and mentoring PhD students and research assistants involved in the projectsPreparing and writing some project proposals related to research projectsRequirementsMaster’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related fieldCandidates with Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field may be considered for Research Assistant roleStrong scientific publication profile and recordStrong research responsibilities in project managementStrong programming skills on Python and MatlabThere will be a 6-12 months industry attachment

Job Description: Position Summary:As a Senior Scientist within Illumina’s Consumables Manufacturing Science team, you will work as part of a multi-disciplinary team to develop methods for the production and testing of new process formulas, technologies and products for Array and Sequencing products. Job Description: The Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering (SCELSE) is a unique interdisciplinary Research Centre of Excellence (RCE), funded by National Research Foundation, Ministry of Education, Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and National University of Singapore (NUS). Hosted by NTU in partnership with NUS, SCELSE is linking new insights from the life sciences with expertise from emerging technologies in engineering and natural sciences to understand, harness and control microbial biofilm communities and microbiomes.SCELSE hosts a genome sequencing facility with multiple state-of-the-art instruments generating petabytes of data every year and is supported by a high-performance computing (HPC) system and multi-petabytes high-performance data storage system. The facility includes Illumina instruments (MiSeq, HiSeq, HiSeqX), Oxford Nanopore instruments (MinION, PromethION), and a PacBio instrument (PacBio RSII).SCELSE seeks a bioinformatics Research Assistant who will be responsible for the day-to-day operation of the genome sequencing laboratory's IT infrastructure. A solid understanding of genomics sequencing concepts and technologies, familiarity with common bioinformatics analysis tools and data analysis approaches are required for this position.Key Responsibilities:Day-to-day operation of the genome sequencing laboratory's IT infrastructureProviding technical support, which includes managing instrument's raw data and subsequent post-processing, configuring and maintaining sequencing instruments, supporting the wet-lab team, and troubleshooting technical issuesProviding analytical support, which includes benchmarking new methods/protocols or bioinformatics tools, providing technical assessment on new advancements in genomics, and providing data analysis recommendations to other bioinformatics team membersJob Requirements:Bachelor's degree with minimum 3 years of experience in a bioinformatics role with relevant technical, user support, or project experienceDemonstrated hands-on experience in the management and handling of next-gen sequencing instrument data (Illumina, Oxford Nanopore, and/or PacBio) and subsequent data processingStrong understanding of genomics and bioinformatic concepts needed to support the analysis of next-gen sequencing dataDemonstrated hands-on experience in bioinformatics data analysis, e.g., sequence alignment, genome assembly, metagenomics analysisStrong understanding of basic IT infrastructure knowledge, e.g., operating system, networking, data storageCompetence in R, Perl, Python or other scripting language appropriate for bioinformatic analysesExperience in using high-performance computing is a plusExperience in wet-lab molecular biology techniques is a plusStrong project management skillsStrong analytical skills and meticulous attitudeAble to work independently or in a team with minimal supervisionGood communication, writing and presentation skillsWe regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description: Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there's no magic formula to how we do it. And that's the kind of work we want to be part of.You will be joining the Analytical Development team within Clinical Development in Lonza Singapore, focusing on test method validation, development and life cycle management. Job Description: The Ministry of National Development (MND), the lead government agency responsible for land use planning and infrastructure development, aims to transform Singapore into an endearing home and a distinctive global city. At MND, we aspire to create a quality, vibrant and sustainable living environment for our people. We also strive to shape Singapore into a world-class city of knowledge, culture and excellence – one which keeps pace with global challenges and the rising aspirations of Singaporeans.Our Vision:An Endearing Home, A Distinctive Global CityOur Mission:Develop world-class infrastructureCreate a vibrant and sustainable living environmentBuild rooted and cohesive communitiesResearch EconomistThe Research and Strategy Management Division at the Ministry of National Development comprises of the Research and Data Analytics Resource (RaDAR) Unit and the Strategy Management Unit. The RaDAR Unit conducts research studies to inform policy work. The Strategy Management Unit provides alignment and coordination for policy and planning within the MND family and across whole-of-government. The division also has an international relations team which oversees our engagement with foreign counterparts and an emergency preparedness team which oversees and coordinates the organisation’s role during national emergencies.We would like to invite interested applicants to apply for a position as a Research Economist/Senior Research Economist with the RaDAR Unit. You will be part of a dynamic and multi-disciplinary team that provides timely and relevant research output to policy divisions and Senior Management to inform the policy making process.ResponsibilitiesYou will undertake research and analysis on issues that are relevant to the Ministry to enable evidence-based policy formulation. Some of these issues include:Assessing and monitoring public housing affordability, as well as understanding the public housing needs of Singaporeans;Developing surveillance capabilities to better understand key drivers that affect property market prices in Singapore;Deepening our knowledge of housing and related social issues faced by different population segments and the efficacy of related policies; andUnderstanding the social cohesiveness of our community and residents’ sentiments toward the living environment.The research will be carried out using econometric techniques. As a result, applicants must be proficient in employing these techniques to conduct quantitative studies such as policy evaluation, policy modelling, as well as forecasting.Applicants must possess a strong interest in housing-related research, as well as be able to think creatively on how data can be used to inform policy outcomes.In addition, applicants will assist in managing a data lab and maintaining a database. These include:Assisting with data extraction when required by users;Documenting and resolving data related-issues highlighted by users;Planning and executing data governance and security measures;Overseeing data management processes to facilitate data use;Planning and executing the refresh of a data analytics and data warehouse system andPlanning and executing data/digitalisation related initiatives to enhance the functionality of a data lab.RequirementsGiven the assigned tasks and responsibilities, we are looking for applicants with the following traits:Qualifications and/or relevant experience in Economics, Statistics, Data Science and other relevant qualifications;Possess a high level of competency in econometric techniques required for carrying out complex data analysis. Job Description: The Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering (SCELSE) is a unique interdisciplinary Research Centre of Excellence (RCE), funded by National Research Foundation, Ministry of Education, Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and National University of Singapore (NUS). Hosted by NTU in partnership with NUS, SCELSE is linking new insights from the life sciences with expertise from emerging technologies in engineering and natural sciences to understand, harness and control microbial biofilm communities and microbiomes.Phytoplankton (single cell algae) are important members of aquatic ecosystems and responsible for most of the carbon fixation on Earth. The health of their natural communities, frequency and size of the harmful algal blooms they can cause, as well as their production of bioactive and nutrient compounds with practical applications is either dependent or strongly influenced by their interactions with bacteria. The Case laboratory is interested in using bacteria to increase phytoplankton's production of bioactive and nutrient compounds to enable their use in food production.SCELSE is looking for a motivated Research Assistant (RA), who will be trained to use the unique medium-throughput co-culture screening assay developed in the Case lab. S/he will also learn various bioassays to measure algal health and physiology as well as the production of specific metabolites (fluorometric and spectrophotometric readings). Safety practices and operational protocols will be included as part of the training. If time permits, this position could extend to include basic training in microscopy and supervision of undergraduate trainees.Key Responsibilities:Maintain a collection of bacteria and phytoplankton used in laboratory experimentsRegular cultivation of bacteria and algae in a laminar flow hood, aseptic techniques as well as the preparation of bacterial and algal culture mediaPerform routine bioassays screening bacteria and metabolite libraries for their effect on the growth of various phytoplankton and their production of nutrient compounds (e.g., protein, lipids and vitamins)Analyse raw data, prepare data for presentations and prepare reports on the research outputJob Requirements:Bachelor's degree in an area relevant to microbiology, marine biology, molecular biology, or biochemistry (candidate must be qualified in one of the above areas)Good communication skills and ability to work in a teamExperience in aseptic technique and cultivation of bacterial or cell cultureExperience in molecular work (DNA extraction and PCR) is an advantageExperience with basic statistics is an advantageWe regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description: The Disaster Analytics for Society Lab at Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in Singapore is looking for an exceptional candidate for the position of Research Associate. The lab aims to rapidly deploy and produce valuable, actionable research in pre- and post-disaster contexts in Southeast Asia to inform both risk reduction and recovery efforts. The ideal candidate will combine strong analytical research skills with a passion for humanitarian and disaster-related research.BackgroundProf. David Lallemant’s research group, the Disaster Analytics for Society Lab (DASL: www.disaster-analytics.com/), is part of The Asian School of the Environment (ASE), a transdisciplinary and cutting-edge program within NTU. The lab combines rigorous quantitative methods and interdisciplinary tools to reduce the risks faced by cities and communities to natural hazards.The Research Associate will join a dynamic, expanding research group that investigates complex impact that natural hazards have on society. In particular, the selected candidate will have data science expertise that can be deployed to understand and mitigate the impacts of natural hazards on society. The position is particularly well suited for a candidate passionate about data and algorithms for better understanding disaster and climate risk. The candidate will have unique access to large and diverse datasets, new computational facilities for machine learning and spatial data analysis, and diverse collaborators to exchange ideas with.Job ResponsibilitiesConduct quantitative data analysis in support of various research projects on disaster risk and recoveryApply data analysis techniques on large datasets acquired with remote sensing (e.g. optical satellite, streetview, LiDAR, etc)Build object detection and classification models to better understand the vulnerability of the built environment to natural hazardsParticipate in data collection and/or fieldwork using remote sensing equipmentParticipate in and contribute to all project research and management meetingsJob RequirementsMSc degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Computational Modeling, or other related fields. Candidates with a BSc will be considered if they can demonstrate equivalent skills or work experienceProgramming experience, particularly handling large datasets and applying machine learning techniquesSelf-driven, highly motivated, collaborative, with interest to work with other researchers and scientists (team player) to produce high-quality and impactful researchInterest in the field of natural hazards and reducing their impacts on societyExperience with GPU programming is a plusExperience with remote sensing hardware (LiDAR, 360-degree camera) is a plusExperience with computer vision techniques is a plusInterested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and full CV in one document .We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description: Position Summary:Illumina develop the world’s leading next generation DNA sequencing platforms (NGS) which are revolutionizing industries such as healthcare, life sciences, forensics, agro-sciences and clinical research to name a few. Due to Illumina’s drastic growth, there is a growing need for scientists who can apply innovative ideas to the development of our current reagents and formulations. In Singapore, the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team is tasked to innovate and collaborate with our international team of experts to further improve the stability, performance and robustness of our consumable reagents.We are currently recruiting for a Scientist 1 at our Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team, who is keen to be part of our culture of constantly pushing forward the boundaries of science and technology to benefit human health. The successful candidate will carry out scientific R&D in the field of protein stabilization, including process characterization to enhance and improve the reagents used in our NGS and microarray consumables.Position Responsibilities:As a member of the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team, you will collaboratively drive the design and development of high-quality consumable reagents for Illumina sequencing platforms. As Illumina technology continues to grow, you will be a key contributor within multidisciplinary teams by striving to enhance performance and robustness across our entire reagent platform. Your colleagues will count on your biomolecular and/or process engineering expertise and ability to work in multidisciplinary teams to solve complex problems and work on reagent stability issues. You will leverage your expertise in biochemistry, enzymology or biochemical engineering to determine the critical parameters for reagents function, stability, and performance, particularly enzyme-based reagents.To work as part of the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team:Responsibilities:Engage in cross-functional collaboration with protein research teams, platform integration teams, Reagent Manufacturing, Operations and QA/QC teams to accelerate the development of novel consumable reagents used in Illumina’s NGS platformsDesign and execute experiments, analyze and present data demonstrating feasibility of new methodologies and processesEvaluate and employ analytical tools and techniques for protein characterization and demonstrate their predictive value for reagent performance and qualityCharacterize and optimize reagent processing steps to enhance stability and robustness of our consumable productsBe both a strong individual contributor as well as a collaborative team member within multi-disciplinary teamsWritten and verbal communication of plans, procedures and resultsWrite technical reports and prepare presentations for cross functional technical teamsEmploy and explain statistical methods to drive decisionsListed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.Position Requirements:PhD in a relevant field such as biochemistry or biochemical engineering will be desirable. We would also welcome applications from those with experience in operating pilot-scale or large lab-scale chemical processesSkilled in quantification and qualification techniques such as DSC, DLS, CD, optical microscopy, rheometry, electrophoresis, liquid chromatography, activity assays and so onA “can do” attitude, ability to work collaboratively in a team and good communication skillsApplications with Cover Letter will be preferentially consideredAll listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilitiesPreferred Experience/Education/Skills:Experience with enzymes involved in NGS sample preparation or methylation assays, such as transposes, ligases, TET or APOBEC is a plusExperience of operating pilot-scale or large lab-scale biologically orientated processes such as cell culture (fermentation) at 20 litres or above is an advantageExperience with Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) is a plusUnderstanding of protein biochemistry, engineering and structure is a plusPost-doctoral or other experience of working independently is a plusAll About UsIllumina is improving human health by unlocking the power of the genome. Our focus on innovation has established us as the global leader in DNA sequencing and array-based technologies, serving customers in the research, clinical and applied markets. Our products are used for applications in the life sciences, oncology, reproductive health, agriculture and other emerging segments.lllumina has experienced phenomenal growth from $10 million in revenues in 2002 to approximately $2.2 billion in 2015. Forbes named Illumina #1 on the 2009 list of 25 Fastest-Growing Technology Companies in the United States, the second time over a three-year period that Forbes ranked Illumina #1 on its list of rapidly growing technology companies. Job Description: Huawei Singapore Trustworthiness Technology Lab is dedicated to fundamental research on security and privacy protection to the company’s business. Huawei has been providing full-stack, all-scenario AI solution for products and services carriers, enterprises, governments, and individual consumers worldwide. We, the Trustworthy AI Team, are committed to conduct research and development on state-of-the-art trustworthy AI techniques, to build the foundation for trustworthy AI systems, to protect the security and privacy of AI business, to collaborate with the academic to develop a strong fundamental theory of Trustworthy AI, and to cooperate with the industry to contribute to standardization organizations. We are looking for enthusiastic researchers to join us to achieve our commitments.Job Responsibilities:●Conduct research on key cutting-edge technologies to achieve desired trustworthy AI properties, including defense against adversarial attacks, model confidentiality protection, data privacy protection, model verification, model fairness, and model interpretability;●Implement tools and modules for evaluating trustworthy AI properties, enhancing them and/or detecting violations during runtime to enhance our products and services.●Collaborate with universities to bridge the gaps between academic research and industry practices.●Participate in relevant standardization activities and contribute to eco-systems.●For senior positions, you are also required to provide insights and strategies for AI trustworthiness in Huawei’s products and services, and to design the best AI governance, security and privacy protection guidelines.Key Qualifications：●Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field.●Publication record in security or AI conferences (e.g. CCS, S&P, USENIX SECURITY, NDSS, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, etc), other related conferences.●Programming proficiency in Python, other languages are a plus.●Hands-on experience working with deep learning toolkits such as Tensorflow, PyTorch or Mindspore.Position Opportunities:Huawei has been providing innovative ICT infrastructure, products and services to carriers, enterprises, governments, and individual consumers worldwide over the past few decades. In our team, you will be able to contribute your talents in a wide range of AI scenarios and applications, co-create and collaborate with our industrial and academic partners worldwide. Researchers with relevant research backgrounds are welcome to join.

Job Description: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.Job overview:We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Quantitative Strategy team that work on data projects for the public good.As a Data Scientist, you will be identifying opportunities for data exploitation through in depth conversations with business stakeholders. You will scope out data science projects with clear deliverables that are actionable and impactful, and execute them in close iteration with the stakeholders.You are a great communicator who can engage stakeholders on sharpening their business problems, obtaining feedback and sharing findings to influence actionable outcomes. You are dextrous in data manipulation, data modelling and data visualisation, and can identify the most appropriate tools and techniques for each business use case. Job Description: Position Summary:Illumina develop the world’s leading next generation DNA sequencing platforms (NGS) which are revolutionizing industries such as healthcare, life sciences, forensics, agro-sciences and clinical research to name a few. Due to Illumina’s drastic growth, there is a growing need for scientists who can apply innovative ideas to the development of our current reagents and formulations. In Singapore, the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team is tasked to innovate and collaborate with our international team of experts to further improve the stability, performance and robustness of our consumable reagents.We are currently recruiting for a Scientist 1 at our Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team, who is keen to be part of our culture of constantly pushing forward the boundaries of science and technology to benefit human health. The successful candidate will carry out scientific R&D in the field of protein stabilization, including process characterization to enhance and improve the reagents used in our NGS and microarray consumables.Position Responsibilities:As a member of the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team, you will collaboratively drive the design and development of high-quality consumable reagents for Illumina sequencing platforms. As Illumina technology continues to grow, you will be a key contributor within multidisciplinary teams by striving to enhance performance and robustness across our entire reagent platform. Your colleagues will count on your biomolecular and/or process engineering expertise and ability to work in multidisciplinary teams to solve complex problems and work on reagent stability issues. You will leverage your expertise in biochemistry, enzymology or biochemical engineering to determine the critical parameters for reagents function, stability, and performance, particularly enzyme-based reagents.To work as part of the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team:Responsibilities:Engage in cross-functional collaboration with protein research teams, platform integration teams, Reagent Manufacturing, Operations and QA/QC teams to accelerate the development of novel consumable reagents used in Illumina’s NGS platformsDesign and execute experiments, analyze and present data demonstrating feasibility of new methodologies and processesEvaluate and employ analytical tools and techniques for protein characterization and demonstrate their predictive value for reagent performance and qualityCharacterize and optimize reagent processing steps to enhance stability and robustness of our consumable productsBe both a strong individual contributor as well as a collaborative team member within multi-disciplinary teamsWritten and verbal communication of plans, procedures and resultsWrite technical reports and prepare presentations for cross functional technical teamsEmploy and explain statistical methods to drive decisionsListed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.Position Requirements:PhD in a relevant field such as biochemistry or biochemical engineering will be desirable. We would also welcome applications from those with experience in operating pilot-scale or large lab-scale chemical processesSkilled in quantification and qualification techniques such as DSC, DLS, CD, optical microscopy, rheometry, electrophoresis, liquid chromatography, activity assays and so onA “can do” attitude, ability to work collaboratively in a team and good communication skillsApplications with Cover Letter will be preferentially consideredAll listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilitiesPreferred Experience/Education/Skills:Experience with enzymes involved in NGS sample preparation or methylation assays, such as transposes, ligases, TET or APOBEC is a plusExperience of operating pilot-scale or large lab-scale biologically orientated processes such as cell culture (fermentation) at 20 litres or above is an advantageExperience with Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) is a plusUnderstanding of protein biochemistry, engineering and structure is a plusPost-doctoral or other experience of working independently is a plusAll About UsIllumina is improving human health by unlocking the power of the genome. Job Description: We are looking for highly motivated and talented individual with passion in oncology and genomics laboratory research to join the Precision Radiation Oncology Program (PROP). You will primarily work with the Principal Investigator (PI) and the current research and clinical teams. This current advertised job is embedded in the broader PROP. The selected individual is expected to contribute actively to our genomics and radiomics research that is focused on using electronic medical records, next-generation sequencing (NGS) and radiological imaging datasets to developing biomarkers predictive of clinical responses in cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy. This includes both in-house and publicly available datasets. The Research Fellow will be expected to perform genomics and radiomics data processing, statistical analyses, feature extraction for statistical/machine learning and survival analysis, and other relevant computational analyses to better understand the complexity of radioresistance of head and neck cancers and prostate cancers. You will also be required to stay abreast with the latest scientific literature, critically assess papers and guide research discussions with other scientists; in particular you will be involved with inter-departmental collaborations with oncologists, pathologist, scientists, and local and international collaborators.Requirements:- PhD in Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Physics, Biology or other quantitative fields.- Highly motivated, organised, meticulous and committed to high quality standards.- Prior experience in handling data sets (e.g. data curation, cleaning and organisation) is required; needs to be data curious.- Competency in python/R or other computing language is required.- Demonstrable data analysis skills with a portfolio on relevant datasets (e.g. TCGA, Kaggle) is highly favourable.- Familiarity with command line shells (e.g. bash, zsh) is preferred.- Prior experience working with high-performance computing clusters and job schedulers is preferred.- Knowledge and experience in biostatistical analyses of clinical datasets preferred.- Knowledge and experience in genomics analyses (e.g. analyses of WES, RNASeq data) preferred.- Research experience in a Genomics or Oncology or Molecular/Cellular Biology laboratory preferred.- Able to work independently under pressure as well as in a team.- Strong organizational, interpersonal and presentation skills.- Responsible, analytical and self-confident with a mature personality.- Passionate about genomics and oncology research, and keen interest to solve clinical problems.

Job Description: Institute of Catastrophe Risk Management (ICRM) is a multi-disciplinary catastrophe risk management research institute which develops understandings and models of risks which are related to natural disasters such as earthquakes, tsunamis, typhoons, and floods, as well as non-traditional risks such as infectious diseases and terrorism.Natural catastrophes (Nat Cat) disproportionally affect Asia in terms of economic losses and casualties, which in large part could be attributed to the low insurance penetration, low catastrophe (cat) risk awareness in the region and, in comparison with Western countries, lack of effective risk transfer mechanisms of the cat risk. ICRM has established the Natural Catastrophe Data and Analytics Exchange (NatCatDAX) Alliance as an association of industry interest group to address the above-mentioned data and modelling gaps, through an industry-led Nat Cat data and analytics platform for Asia Pacific, starting with SE Asia. Under the Alliance, ICRM has been working with its consortium industrial partners to produce quality-assured economic and industry databases, covering exposure and loss of earthquakes, windstorms (typhoons) and flood, for selected ASEAN Member States. ICRM has now assumed the lead execution role for the ASEAN Disaster Reduction Finance and Insurance Phase 2 (ADRFI-2) Program in the Risk Assessment and Risk Financing Advisory pillars. Job Description: Job Description:We are seeking a talented and driven Senior Scientist to join our dynamic interdisciplinary protein engineering group that is responsible for the high throughput discovery of novel protein mutants for application in Next Generation Sequencing (NGS). The successful candidate will lead a scientific team and initiate, execute and analyze research in the area of protein engineering applied to NGS, collaboratively working with multidisciplinary teams.Background:Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) is a pivotal technology accelerating basic research as well as clinical diagnosis. Illumina is by far the largest provider of NGS instruments globally and has experienced rapid growth over the years, growing from an annual revenue of US$10 million in 2002 to over US$3.2 billion in 2020 and repeatedly featured in lists of fastest growing and smartest companies. This growth is due to Illumina's relentless focus on innovation.To further push the boundaries of NGS technology, we're looking for a Senior Scientist who will be tasked with evolving enzyme mutants with improved properties to enable new sequencing methods.Tasks and Responsibilities:Plan, execute and analyze various laboratory experiments to screen/engineer and/or characterize novel enzymes for NGS, with defined goals and timeframes.Lead a team focused on screening, engineering and characterization of novel enzymes for NGS, with defined goals and timeframes.Participate in multi disciplinarily protein engineering projects and interact with engineers, chemists, and protein scientists, to deliver protein variants with desired properties.All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.Preferred Educational Background:PhD in biochemistry, structural biology or protein engineering.Experience with NGS data analysis or bioinformatics is desirable.Preferred Experiential Background:5 or more years of hands-on experience inhigh throughput screening, expression, purification and biochemical characterization of enzymes or nucleic acid binding proteins (e.g. DNA repair proteins, ligases, polymerases, recombinases, etc.).2 or more years of experience leading scientific teams and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced biotech environment.Sound understanding of the latest genomics technologies and methodologies.Good communication skills.Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Job Description: IMRE is looking for a research scientist to join our research efforts in quantum nanosensing. The main project focuses on developing quantum sensors based on colour centres in diamond, and their integration with scanning probe systems. The successful candidate will work on the following:Develop AFM-compatible diamond probes with tailored colour centre composition and propertiesIntegrate diamond probes, optics, and RF equipment with AFM system for magnetic field measurementsPerform nanosensing experiments and data analysisExplore applications of nanosensing capability in metamaterials, nanophotonics, surface science, and microelectronicsJob RequirementsPhD in a relevant Physics or Engineering fieldAble to independently plan and execute research workBackground in experimental optics and/or quantum sensingExperience with scanning probe systems, especially AFMAbility to program (especially Python or C) lab equipment for testing automationFamiliarity with confocal microscopy, magnetic field measurements, and RF equipment highly desiredThe above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. Job Description:
A bioinformatician position (BSc/MSc) is available at the A*STAR IMCB ???Laboratory of Chromatin Dynamics & Disease Epigenetics.
Our laboratory is interested to study chromatin dynamics in development and disease, with a particular focus on cancer (Hu et al., Nature Cell Biology 2020). To this end, we leverage next-generation sequencing technologies to investigate how transcriptional and epigenetic dysregulations lead to carcinogenesis. Through integrative analyses of cancer epigenomic, genomic and transcriptomic data, we aim to obtain a comprehensive understanding of the complex architecture of cancer genomes, and to identify potential cancer vulnerabilities for therapeutic intervention. For more information about the lab, please see: https://wwteelab.com
Job Requirements
We are looking for a candidate with some experience working with next generation sequencing datasets such as RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq, Methyl-Seq as well as Hi-C/Hi-ChIP.
?? Bachelor???s/Master???s/PhD degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, or a related field. 
?? Proficiency in R and/or Python scripting language. 
?? Prior experience with next-generation-sequencing data analysis such as those listed above, and able to perform multi-modal integration of the different -omics datasets. 
?? Track record of peer-reviewed publications in relevant disciplines will be advantageous. 
?? Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
?? Able to undertake independent research and be an effective team player. 
An attractive remuneration package that is commensurate with the qualifications, track record and working experience of the successful candidate will be provided. The successful candidate will also have the opportunity to lead projects and work collaboratively with others in conceptualizing and conducting research projects.
Interested applicants should email his/her curriculum vitae, a cover letter addressing research interest, experience and skills, and contact information of three referees toDr. Wee-Wei Tee([emailprotected]).

Job Description: Position Summary:         Illumina develop the world's leading next generation DNA sequencing platforms (NGS) which are revolutionizing industries such as healthcare, life sciences, forensics, agro-sciences and clinical research to name a few. Due to Illumina's drastic growth, there is a growing need for scientists who can apply innovative ideas to the development of our current reagents and formulations. In Singapore, the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team is tasked to innovate and collaborate with our international team of experts to further improve the stability, performance and robustness of our consumable reagents.We are currently recruiting for a Research Associate 2 at our Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team, who is keen to be part of our culture of constantly pushing forward the boundaries of science and technology to benefit human health. The successful candidate will carry out scientific R&D in the field of protein stabilization, including process characterization to enhance and improve the reagents used in our NGS and microarray consumables.Position Responsibilities:As a junior scientist of the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team, you will collaboratively drive the design and development of high-quality consumable reagents for Illumina sequencing platforms. As Illumina technology continues to grow, you will be a key contributor within multidisciplinary teams tasked to enhance performance and robustness across our entire reagent platform. Your colleagues will count on your expertise and ability to work in multidisciplinary teams to solve complex problems and work on reagent stability issues. You will leverage your expertise in biochemistry, enzymology or biochemical engineering to determine the critical parameters for reagents function, stability, and performance, particularly for enzyme-based reagents.To work as part of the Core Consumables Development (Singapore) team:Responsibilities:Engage in cross-functional collaboration with protein research teams, platform integration teams, Reagent Manufacturing, Operations and QA/QC teams to accelerate the development of novel consumable reagents used in Illumina's NGS platformsAs part of a team, develop methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining world-class resultsExecute biophysical and biochemical characterization experiments for critical components of Illumina sequencing reagents under supervisionExecute various laboratory activities in a team environmentEmploy analytical tools for protein or small molecule characterization and demonstrate their predictive value for reagent performance and qualityWrite technical reports and communicate effectively to local leadershipBe a strong team member within multi-disciplinary teamsEmploy and explain statistical methods to drive decisionsListed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.Position Requirements:B.Sc./B.Eng. or M.Sc./M.Eng. in a relevant field such as biochemistry, biochemical/chemical engineering or equivalent is required2+ years work experience in biochemical, pharma, chemical or equivalent industriesFamiliarity in quantification and qualification techniques such as DSC, DLS, CD, optical microscopy, rheometry, electrophoresis, liquid chromatography, activity assays and so onA 'can do' attitude, ability to work collaboratively in a team and good communication skillsApplication with Cover Letter will be preferentially consideredAll listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilitiesPreferred Experience/Education/Skills:- Experience with enzymes involved in NGS sample preparation or methylation assays, such as transposes, ligases, TET or APOBEC is a plus- Experience of operating pilot-scale or large lab-scale processes such as cell culture (fermentation) at 20 litres or above is an advantage- Understanding of protein biochemistry, engineering and structure is a plus- Experience with Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) is not required but is a plusAll About UsIllumina is improving human health by unlocking the power of the genome. Our focus on innovation has established us as the global leader in DNA sequencing and array-based technologies, serving customers in the research, clinical and applied markets. Our products are used for applications in the life sciences, oncology, reproductive health, agriculture and other emerging segments.lllumina has experienced phenomenal growth from $10 million in revenues in 2002 to approximately $2.2 billion in 2015. Forbes named Illumina #1 on the 2009 list of 25 Fastest-Growing Technology Companies in the United States, the second time over a three-year period that Forbes ranked Illumina #1 on its list of rapidly growing technology companies. Illumina was also named #1 smartest company in the world as part of MIT's 2014 Technology Review.
